statement: The company generated consolidated revenues of US $25.7 billion, experiencing strong growth of 15.9%.
TCS has a cash conversion ratio of 104.2% and free cash flow of ₹36,985 crore.
The company successfully completed its fourth buyback, amounting to over 102.8% of the free cash flow.
TCS ranked #1 in Customer Satisfaction in the UK for the ninth consecutive year.
The company has crossed a key diversity milestone with women in the workforce exceeding 200,000.
TCS’ attrition in IT services was 17.4% in FY 2022, indicating a sharp rise in employee turnover across the industry.
The supply chain upheavals during the past couple of years are driving a shift towards rebalancing and resilience.
The geo-political tensions in Europe and the resultant impact on global economic growth are real threats.
The company aims to deepen customer relationships, expand its addressable market, and gain market share in the years ahead.
TCS expects technology spending to continue growing, with a focus on cloud migration and digital workplace initiatives.
The company is confident of being able to sustain a certain base case growth, with room to maximize in better years.
The change in technology consumption reflects the prevailing trends in the economy, which may impact business operations.
The COVID-19 pandemic continues to pose risks to business continuity and employee health.
The company faces risks related to volatile global economic scenarios and potential reductions in client spending.
